criteria.question: Participation of women and men in project identification

sub_criteria.question: Has the project consulted women and men, women’s groups, or NGOs on the problem or issue that the intervention must solve and on the development of the solution?
Have women’s inputs been considered in the design of the project?
Are both women and men seen as stakeholders, partners, or agents of change in the project design?

criteria.question: Collection of sex-disaggregated data and gender-related information prior to project design

sub_criteria.question: Has the project tapped sex-disaggregated data and gender-related information from secondary and primary sources at the project identification stage? OR, does the project document include sex- disaggregated and gender information in the analysis of the development issue or problem?

criteria.question: Conduct of gender analysis and identification of gender issues

sub_criteria.question: Gender division of labor and gender needs
Are the needs of both women and men considered in the situation analysis?
Has the situation analysis considered how the productive and reproductive roles of woman and man workers and clients affect their effective use of ICT facilities and services?
Access to and control of resources

Has the situation analysis considered the gender gaps in terms of the resources of women and men and how this is likely to affect their access to ICT facilities, services, and employment opportunities? (
Has the situation analysis covered the causes of gender gaps in resources, particularly ICT resources?
Constraints
Has the situation analysis considered the possible constraints to women’s and men’s participation in the activities and benefits of the proposed project?

criteria.question: Gender equality goals, outcomes, and outputs

sub_criteria.question: Do the project objectives explicitly refer to woman and man clients, workers, and officials of the ICT sector as beneficiaries of the project?
Does the project set gender equality outputs and outcomes in terms access, participation, and control?

criteria.question: Matching of strategies with gender issues

sub_criteria.question: Do the strategies match the gender issues and gender equality goals? That is, will the project eliminate or at least reduce gender gaps and inequities?

name: Gender Analysis of the Designed Project

criteria.question: Gender analysis of the designed project

sub_criteria.question: Gender division of labor
Have the needs of women and men been considered in the formulation and design of the project?
Will the new ICT facility or service address issues related to the displacement or deskilling of woman and man workers?
Does the project provide measures to avoid or reduce the negative effects of the introduction of the ICT facility or service on the division of labor?
Access to and control of resources
Does the project ensure that opportunities for training and scholarships which may be provided by the project are equally accessible to women and men?
Will the new technology or application of ICT offer greater protection to women?
Is information about the new ICT opportunities (such as e-commerce, e-governance) readily available to women and men, particularly those in the marginalized sectors?
Constraints
Has the project addressed any constraint faced particularly by women in attending project- sponsored training?
Has the project considered the financial costs of participation in the ICT project that may restrict access to the benefits of the new technology?

Does the project include gender equality targets andindicators for welfare, access, consciousness raising,participation, and control? For instance, will thefollowing gender differences be monitored: Increased rate of apprehension of criminals, by sex of victims andperpetrators, and by type of crime, Rate of utilization of the ICT-driven service, by sex of users, Time savings produced by ICT-driven service, by sex of users, Participation in training and other project activities, Employment generated by the project
Does the proposed project monitoring framework or plan include the collection of sex-disaggregated data?
Is the budget allotted by the project sufficient for gender equality promotion or integration?

Does the project have the expertise to integrate GAD or promote gender equality and women’s empowerment? OR, will the project invest in building capacity for integrating GAD or promoting gender equality?

criteria.question: Relationship with the agency’s GAD efforts

sub_criteria.question: Will the project build on or strengthen agency/ PCW/government’s commitment to the advancement of women?
Does the project have an exit plan that will ensure the sustainability of GAD efforts and benefits?
Will the project build on the initiatives or actions of other organizations in the area?
